author: Odeinoichus
title: Beware the Queen of the Vampires. But only if you have anything Red.
review:
Set #71285 Adventure Time Fun Pack: We’re seeing a lot of lasts with Series 2, in the previous Review we saw the Last Level Pack ever made for LEGO Dimensions, and now here is the Last Adventure Time pack made for LEGO Dimensions. Sorry folks, no Bubblegum Princess to play as, only Marceline the Vampire Queen. But she’s a pretty impressive character with a high number of abilities, as we’re about to discuss.

Packaging

The packaging for Marceline is similar to all of the rest of the LEGO Dimensions Fun Pack boxes and works quite well, Marceline is seen on the front and quite frightening looking for a LEGO Minifigure.

Parts

This set features a lot of black elements and some rarer purple plates, 1x2 and circle plates mostly, this is a pretty decent parts pack though it is pricy for such a thing unless purchased at deep discount from retail.

Minifigures

Marceline: Using dual-molded legs for her shoes/boots Marceline has a simple, yet effective print on her torso and some suitable facial expressions. She includes a buildable guitar axe which is pretty neat looking. Fun fact, Marceline is the first LEGO vampire character to depict the two points on the neck where she has been drained of her blood in the torso print, a first for LEGO referencing how vampires are officially made.

Her toy tag is printed with a guitar motif which looks really impressive.

The build

Lunatic Amp: Have you ever wanted to build a walking speaker system that can attack your enemies? Well here’s your chance, this is a really clever build idea, I think it’s from the show, but again I haven’t seen every single episode so I’m not 100% sure on that. It’s a great little build though and really impressive.

Shadow Scorpion: Here’s the second build, a very good re-use of the parts for this model design. Enjoyed what this is, though as you build you’ll notice it’s a bit bulky in how it looks, which is true of all the builds in this set.

Heavy Metal Monster: Welcome to the third and final build, this set has three very solid build ideas and this final build is very fun and quick to complete. I honestly don’t have much to discuss here, every aspect of this trio of builds is immensely satisfying.

The completed model

Lunatic Amp & Alternate Builds: Again I find myself wondering which of the three builds is the best here, Lunatic Amp is a solid looking beast of a model which matches the digital model really faithfully. The Shadow Scorpion is quirky fun with the ability for a character to sit on top of it via the studs, and then we come to the Heavy Metal Monster. This model is all around fun. It’s a bit awkward due to the scale for achieving any interesting poses, but it still works and is a really fun toy to goof around with and interact with your collection.

The Digital Content

Adventure World: Welcome back to the Land of Oo, yep, Marceline unlocks the same Adventure World, so… not really much to say here unfortunately.

Battle Arena: Marceline unlocks the unique Adventure Time Pillow World After Dark battle arena, which means you’re revisiting Finn’s battle arena only it’s nighttime now. A really easy to make level I suppose and it’s definitely somewhat lazy as the content really isn’t new, but it’ll be one more multiplayer arena to visit with your allies or enemies to duke it out in.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: As I noted above Marceline has a massive amount of abilities, she has Acrobat, Laser Deflector, Dig, Flying, Heart Regen, Sonar Smash, Stealth, Magic, Slurp Access, Mini Access, Tracking, Vine Cut and can destroy Cracked LEGO Objects or Cursed Red LEGO Objects. This means Marceline is a go-to character for solving a large number of puzzles.

The Lunatic Amp has Sonar Smash and Super Jump as well as Dig and Tow-Bar of all abilities, when I see an Amp I don’t think I can pull down walls to get access to LEGO passages or collectibles, but hey, it’s Marceline. The Shadow Scorpion has a Special Attack with the Tow-Bar, Flight Docks, and Flight Cargo Hooks abilities while the Heavy Metal Monster gives you the Guardian Ability for battles, has Sonar Smash and can Destroy Cracked or Red Demon LEGO Objects.

Overall opinion

I’d recommend Marceline as one of the better offerings, she has a host of abilities for solving puzzles, which means you can avoid buying needless packs and features three great buildable models as part of the physical aspect of her toy. She’s also a unique character design and I really think she stands out better than some other Minifigures I could name. Highly Recommended.
